avalancheActivity.highlights: Recent low-wind snowfall in the region may compromise snowpack stability. Ongoing SW snowfall and strong winds have created windslabs widely in NW-SE facing hills.

snowpackStructure.highlights: SW winds and snowfall has dominated last week and some new snow fell in low winds. It got warm high in the mountains with rain early on Friday so snow melted and subsided widely. Temperatures have dropped again and the new snow is dry, cold and loosely packed. A snowpit analysis was conducted in Bláfjöll on the 30th of January in a NW facing aspect, revealing dominantly drift snow with thin layers of hail in between. An extended column test indicated a potential issue with high load (ECTN26 @80cm). Snow accumulation has been localized in certain areas recently, raising the possibility of thick wind slabs in NW-SE facing hills under the new powder snow.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowfall this week. Early on Friday a lot of snow melted and it rained but the frost returned quickly. A weak layer has been discovered where new colder snow has buried the warm wet snow. Some new powder snow is in the SW corner and innand that could compromise the snowpack stability.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowshowers. New snow is widely in the SW corner that could compromise stability.

weatherForecast.highlights: Aust- til norðaustlægar áttir, úrkomulaust og hægur vindur á mánudag er lægðarbóla gengur suður fyrir land. Norðlægari áttir á þriðjudag og líkur á lítilsháttar éljabökkum með kvöldinu og aðfaranótt miðvikudags. Áframhaldandi frost allt að -17 gráður til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.comment: Small avalanche fell by the road through Hálfdán on Saturday as a small slab released on a thin crust layer from the thaw weather on Friday. 2 avalanches fell on and right by Súðavíkurhlíð early on Saturday. Avalanches also fell in Súðavíkurhlíð on the evening of 30th of Jan and night of 1st of Feb. Many small avalanches released in the area after heavy snowfall and snowdrift on early Thursday 25th of Jan.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow was melted up to 600m height before the weekend and a weak layer formed after it froze again as new snow has covered older wet snow. Snow has also widely drifted and formed wind slabs in various aspects. More snowfall in northern winds is expected for Tuesday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Throughout the past week, snow fell widely, accompanied by drifting in variable winds, dominantly SW. The region had a limited snow cover prior to this period. On January 30th, a snowpit analysis was conducted in Seljalandsdalur, revealing layered wind slabs with a hard thin layer between them atop melt/freeze snow. A compression test indicated a straight fracture under medium stress in the newer wind slabs (CT13/15@56cm). Although the upper layers of the snowpack melted temporarily over the weekend before the return of frost, a vulnerability in the snowpack emerged as dry, cold snow covered warmer, wet snow. While the thawing duration was brief, it was sufficient to create a thin layer susceptible to faceting within the snowpack.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowfall this week. Early on Friday a lot of snow melted and it rained but the frost returned quickly. A weak layer has been discovered where new colder snow has buried the warm wet snow. Some new powder snow is in the SW corner and innand that could compromise the snowpack stability.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowshowers. New snow is widely in the SW corner that could compromise stability.

weatherForecast.highlights: Lítilsháttar éljagangur í NA átt snemma á mánudag en lægir með deginum og úrkomulaust. Á þriðjudag snjóar í hvössum norðlægum áttum en styttir upp með miðvikudeginum. Frost -7 til -14 gráður til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.comment: A small slabs in lower part of mountains.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Windslabs are on N-E aspects after strong SW winds. Light northerly winds with some snowfall next days, stronger winds in the northern most parts by the coast.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Windslabs and cornices are present, especially on N-E aspects after SW winds lately. Few small slabs have been reported in lower part of mountains that possibly are releasing on the thaw interface from 1st of feb. No recent snowpits.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowfall this week. Early on Friday a lot of snow melted and it rained but the frost returned quickly. A weak layer has been discovered where new colder snow has buried the warm wet snow. Some new powder snow is in the SW corner and innand that could compromise the snowpack stability.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowshowers. New snow is widely in the SW corner that could compromise stability.

weatherForecast.highlights: Talverður SV-skafrenningur var föstudag og laugardag. Hæg norðlæg átt og smá snjókoma á mánudag. NV-NA strkkings vindur á þriðjudag og miðvikudag með snjókomu.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few small avalanches occurred in Norðfjörður last weekend. A small wet sluff occurred above Neskaupstaður last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Windslabs high in mountains but old stable snow in lower part of mountains.

snowpackStructure.highlights: High in mountains there is dry recent snow that has formed windslabs. In lower part of mountains snow has subsided and melted and is considered stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowfall this week. Early on Friday a lot of snow melted and it rained but the frost returned quickly. A weak layer has been discovered where new colder snow has buried the warm wet snow. Some new powder snow is in the SW corner and innand that could compromise the snowpack stability.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowshowers. New snow is widely in the SW corner that could compromise stability.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæg breytileg átt og úrkomu lítið. Vaxandi V-átt á þriðjudag. Hvöss norðlæg átt með snjókomu og skafrenningi á miðvikudag.
